skill.name: pr-description
skill.description: Guide for creating comprehensive PR descriptions with proper structure, diagrams, and documentation for code reviews.
skill.summary: Guide for creating comprehensive PR descriptions with proper structure, diagrams, and documentation ...
skill.author: BfdCampos

security_audit.summary: Documentation-only skill containing markdown guidance and templates. No executable code exists. Static findings are false positives: the 'weak cryptographic algorithm' detections are SHA-256 hashes in metadata (safe by design), and 'external_commands' detections are markdown code block examples showing testing commands, not actual shell execution. The skill only provides templates and does not access files, git, or networks.

content.value_statement: Writing clear PR descriptions helps reviewers understand changes faster and reduces review time. This skill provides structured templates, Mermaid diagram guidance, and best practices for documenting code changes effectively.
actual_capabilities: Generate structured PR description templates with required sections
Create Mermaid data flow diagrams for architecture changes
Build Mermaid ER diagrams for database schema changes
Provide testing documentation templates with command examples
Guide users on writing reviewer-focused change summaries
Include future work and technical debt tracking sections
limitations: Does not access git repositories or read existing PRs
Does not automatically pull test results or build status
User must provide specific change details and context
Does not integrate with GitHub, GitLab, or other platforms

use_cases.title: Document feature PRs
use_cases.description: Create detailed PR descriptions for feature branches that help reviewers understand complex changes quickly.

use_cases.title: Review PR documentation
use_cases.description: Ensure submitted PRs have complete testing evidence, diagrams, and clear change summaries before review.

use_cases.title: Standardise PR templates
use_cases.description: Establish consistent PR documentation standards across the team with built-in templates and guidelines.

prompt_templates.title: New feature PR
prompt_templates.prompt: Create a pull request description for my feature that adds user authentication with JWT tokens. Include data flow diagram, testing results, and reviewer notes.

prompt_templates.title: Bug fix PR
prompt_templates.prompt: Write a PR description for fixing the login timeout issue. Show what changed, how it was tested, and any edge cases covered.

prompt_templates.title: Refactor PR
prompt_templates.prompt: Create a PR description for the database query refactor. Include ER diagram showing new relationships and performance improvements measured.

prompt_templates.title: Large feature PR
prompt_templates.prompt: Generate a comprehensive PR description for the payment system overhaul. Include full data flow, all test commands run, and breaking changes noted.

output_examples.input: Create a PR description for my refactor that changes session storage to Redis
output: # PR Title: Refactor session storage to use Redis backend
## Data Flow Diagram - Mermaid diagram showing session flow
## Changes - List of modified files and why
## Notes for Reviewers - Key areas to focus on

output_examples.input: Document a bug fix for the payment processing timeout
output: # PR Title: Fix payment processing timeout bug
## Changes - Root cause and fix details
## Testing - Commands run to verify fix
## Edge cases covered - Timeout scenarios tested

output_examples.input: Write a PR description for a new API endpoint
output: # PR Title: Add user profile API endpoint
## Summary - Purpose of the new endpoint
## Data Flow - How data flows through the endpoint

best_practices: Include exact commands run during testing to prove changes work
Add Mermaid diagrams for complex architecture or data changes
Explain the business context and why behind changes, not just the what
anti_patterns: Leaving testing section empty or with vague statements like tests passed
Skipping the data flow diagram for complex architectural changes
Using generic titles like Update files instead of descriptive PR titles

faq.question: What tools does this skill work with?
faq.answer: Works with Claude, Codex, and Claude Code. Provides prompts and templates that work in any AI coding assistant.

faq.question: What is the maximum PR description length?
faq.answer: There is no fixed limit, but keep sections scannable with bullet points. Long descriptions should use headers for navigation.

faq.question: Can I save PR descriptions to files?
faq.answer: Yes, the skill provides a naming pattern: pr_description_<title>_<timestamp>.md. Users choose their own file location.

faq.question: Is my code or data accessed?
faq.answer: No. This skill only provides guidance and templates. It does not read files, access git repositories, or make network calls.

faq.question: Why are my PR descriptions not detailed?
faq.answer: Common issues: missing test commands, no diagrams for complex changes, or not explaining the business context. The skill provides templates to address these gaps.

faq.question: How is this different from GitHub PR templates?
faq.answer: GitHub templates are static files in the repo. This skill generates dynamic descriptions with Mermaid diagrams and adapts to your specific changes.
